title: Quiz 6: Prevention & Health Promotion
topicName: Unit Six: STIs and HIV AIDS
description: Assess your understanding of preventive strategies like ABC, PMTCT, and the socio-economic impact of HIV/AIDS.

questions.question: In the ABC prevention strategy, what does 'A' stand for?
questions.explanation: A = Abstinence, B = Be faithful, C = Condom use.

questions.question: What is the chance of a mother transmitting HIV to her child without intervention?
questions.explanation: Without medical intervention, the risk of vertical transmission is approximately 30-40%.

questions.question: Which strategies help prevent Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Administering Nevirapine to mother and baby

questions.explanation: PMTCT involves ARVs (Nevirapine), safe delivery practices (C-section, avoiding trauma/episiotomy), and safe feeding strategies (breastfeeding carries risk).
questions.hint: Avoid practices that expose the baby to blood.

questions.question: Approximately one-third of mother-to-child transmission occurs through ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Breastfeeding is a significant mode of transmission post-delivery.

questions.question: How does HIV/AIDS impact the agricultural sector?

options.text: It deprives the country of its most productive labor force (ages 15-45)
It lowers the cost of labor

questions.explanation: HIV/AIDS strikes the most productive age group, leading to a loss of skilled/unskilled labor and threatening food security.

questions.question: Alcohol and drug abuse can increase the risk of HIV transmission by impairing judgment leading to unprotected sex.
questions.explanation: True. Impaired judgment often leads to risky sexual behaviors.
questions.hint: Does being drunk help you make safe decisions?

questions.question: Match the sector with the impact of HIV/AIDS:

pairs.right: Reduced labor productivity, loss of skilled workforce
Reduced life expectancy, increased infant mortality

questions.explanation: Health: costs/TB. Education: teachers/dropouts. Economy: labor/productivity. Demography: population structure/life expectancy.
questions.hint: Match the specific consequence to the field.

questions.question: What is 'Autologous Transfusion'?

options.text: Using blood from a family member
Using the patient's own blood obtained earlier

questions.explanation: Autologous transfusion involves using the patient's own blood to avoid infection risks from donors.

questions.question: Which of the following is defined as an 'AIDS Orphan'?

options.text: A child under 15 who loses their mother to AIDS
A child over 18 who loses a parent

questions.explanation: The text defines an AIDS orphan as a child under 15 who loses their mother to the disease.
questions.hint: Focus on age and the parent lost.

questions.question: Read the following statement: 'HIV/AIDS has reversed gains in infant mortality and life expectancy.' This refers to impact on which area?

richContent.content: Impact Statement: Key development indicators such as life expectancy and child mortality have worsened due to the epidemic.

questions.explanation: Changes in life expectancy and mortality rates are demographic impacts.
